page.title: 03HOUSES IN CHEDZOY
page.content: CHEDZOY IS A MIXTURE OF OLD AND NEW BUILDINGS. THE NEW HOUSES AT WESTFIELD FARM ARE BEING BUILT. THEY COST Â£72,000 TO BUY.WE HAVE 12 AIREY COUNCIL HOUSES.THEY WERE PREFABRICATED AFTER THE WAR AND HAVE DEVELOPED STRUCTURAL FAULTS WHICH THE COUNCIL IS TO RECTIFY.WE HAVE 12 TRADITIONAL COUNCIL HOUSES WHICH HAVE BEEN RECENTLY MODERNISED. MYRTLE COTTAGE,OPPOSITE THE CHURCH, IS PROBABLY CHEDZOY'S OLDEST BUILDING APART FROM THE CHURCH,WHICH DATES FROM NORMAN AND TUDOR TIMES.THIS COTTAGE,EAST COTT,THE OLD POST OFFICE,COURT FARM, CHURCH COTTAGE,CROSS COTTAGE ARE ALL BUILT OF COB.OLD STONE BUILDINGS ARE FISHER'S FARM,WESTFIELD FARM,SIBLEY'S FARM,THE OLD RECTORY,MANOR FARM.THERE ARE SOME OLD BRICK BUILDINGS.18 NEW HOUSES WERE BUILT IN THE EARLY 1970'S.
